issues.description: The problem statement specifies calculateTotalPrice(Meal) should return a double (both in UML and in text describing “double precision”), but in the solution implementation this method is declared to return an int. This mismatch could confuse students about the correct return type and undermine the intended precision teaching point.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of calculateTotalPrice to return a double (e.g. `public static double calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal)`) and use a double accumulator in its implementation to preserve the intended precision.
